results.title: Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde = Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Nightmare: the birth of horror”.
As legend would have it, Robert Louis Stevenson would awake from a nightmare one night in 1885 inspired to write “Dr Jekyll & Mr Hyde,” a tale that many critics have viewed at various times as an aberration to an otherwise successful literary career of writing adventure stories. It wasn’t the first of his nightmares though, as this informative documentary traces RLS’s childhood in Edinburgh, Scotland, which was fraught with his own medical problems, absent parents, and a very close relationship with his religious zealot Nanny. It was a time permeated by nightmares. Researched, written and presented by Professor Christopher Frayling, this episode in “Nightmare: the birth of horror” series focuses on the inspiration behind Stevenson’s tale of a divided self with a heart of darkness, its questionable sexuality, the influence of Jack the Ripper and deviance from the original work, and the impact that fans and family - in particular his wife who oversaw his authorised biography - have had on influencing the cult of Robert Louis Stevenson that is perpetuated today.

results.title: Dr Isabel Joy Bear
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Isabel Joy Bear began her extensive career in science in the 1940s and today is an Honorary Fellow with CSIRO Minerals. In the 1960s Bear discovered a number of previously unknown metastable zirconium sulfate hydrates. Joy was appointed a Member of the Order of Australia in 1986 for services to science, particularly in the field of mineral chemistry. She is a fellow of both the Royal Australian Chemical Institute (RACI) and the Australasian Institute of Mining and Metallurgy, and in 1988 became the first woman to receive the Leighton Medal - the RACI’s premier award.

results.title: Dr Heidegger's experiment
results.creator_credit: Larry Yust and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Short story showcase”.
An adaptation of Nathaniel Hawthorne’s symbolic tale of a wise old doctor who proves to his friends that age and wisdom are not necessarily synonymous.

results.title: Dr H. C. 'Nugget' Coombs (A)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australian biography”.
Economist, chancellor, patron and advocate of the Arts and Aboriginal affairs, Dr. H.C. “Nugget” Coombs is one of Australia’s most influential public servants and advisor to seven Australian Prime Ministers. Born in Kalamunda, Western Australia, in 1906 (died 1997), Herbert Cole Coombs speaks to interviewer Robin Hughes of how he first became passionate about economics and redressing the issue of racial antagonism, his time at the London School of Economics and his exposure to the inefficiency of the economic system there. He also talks of his years as economist to the treasury in Canberra after the outbreak of war, his role in Rationing, as head of Post War reconstruction, Governor of the Commonwealth Bank, as well as various Arts agencies. Coombs also talks briefly of his working relationship with Chifley, Menzies, Holt, Gorton, McMahon and Whitlam. He also reflects on achievements, regrets and thoughts and fears for the future.

results.title: Dr Fred D. Miller and the gateway to health
results.creator_credit: Robert Edmonds, John Ott and John Ott Pictures
results.brief_description: General physical health and hygiene practices as the basis of good dental health. A practising dentist shows how errors of diet and poor dental hygiene lead to poor teeth and avoidable cavities. Patients who have eaten the right foods all their lives and made a practice of finishing a meal with a crisp fruit have near-perfect teeth when in their fifties.

results.title: Dr DeBakey
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer and Harold Mayer Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
The story of Dr Michael DeBakey, world renowned heart specialist and innovator of new techniques in surgery and new materials for building body organs. We follow Dr DeBakey from early morning through the entire day, forever fighting the clock.

results.title: Dr Coppelius = El Fantastico mundo del Dr Coppelius
results.creator_credit: Ted Kneeland, Frank J. Hale, Frank J Hales Productions and Copelia
results.brief_description: Based on the ballet Coppelia this film adaptation focuses more on the Doctor and his wonderful mechanical dolls as the central plot to the story rather than on Coppelia, the doll itself. The principal characters of the story are: Dr Coppelius (played by actor Walter Slezak), a practical joker who dabbles in witchcraft and sorcery and loves making life-like mechanical dolls, Franz (Caj Selling) the young lover who does not realise that the beautiful Coppelia is one of the Doctor’s mechanical dolls, Swanhilda (Claudia Corday), Franz’s bride-to-be, and Brigitta (Eileen Elliott), the tavern maid secretly in love with Dr Coppelius. The story is based on an original libretto by Charles Nuitter and music by Leo Delibes. Features the members of the Ballet of the Gran Teatro Del Liceo of Barcelone and the International Cine Ballet and the Orchestra of the Gran Teatro Del Liceo of Barcelone under the direction of Adrian Sardo.

results.title: Downton Abbey
results.creator_credit: Carnival Films & Television and ITV Studios
results.brief_description: A chronicle of the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants in the post-Edwardian era—with great events in history having an effect on their lives and on the British social hierarchy.
results.description: A chronicle of the lives of the aristocratic Crawley family and their servants in the post-Edwardian era—with great events in history having an effect on their lives and on the British social hierarchy.

results.title: Downton Abbey
results.creator_credit: Liz Trubridge, Julian Fellowes, Michael Engler, Donal Woods, Gareth Neame, Focus Features, Carnival Films & Television and Perfect World Pictures
results.brief_description: The beloved Crawleys and their intrepid staff prepare for the most important moment of their lives. A royal visit from the King and Queen of England will unleash scandal, romance and intrigue that will leave the future of Downton hanging in the balance.
